meanings.definition: Food prepared in a restaurant to be eaten elsewhere.
meanings.sent1: I love getting takeout from my favorite Chinese restaurant.
meanings.sent2: Let's order takeout for dinner tonight.
meanings.sent3: The takeout from the Italian place was so delicious, I ate it all in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: Her takeout from the new sushi spot was a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the takeout filled the room, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: The act of removing something from a particular place.
meanings.sent1: His takeout of the trash was a big help around the house.
meanings.sent2: The takeout of the old furniture made room for the new couch.
meanings.sent3: She did a quick takeout of the weeds in the garden before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: The takeout of the old books from the shelf revealed a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The takeout of the batteries from the remote fixed the problem.

meanings.definition: The act of taking out money from a bank account.
meanings.sent1: I needed to do a takeout from my savings to pay for the car repairs.
meanings.sent2: He made a takeout from the ATM before heading to the concert.
meanings.sent3: Her takeout from the bank was to buy a special birthday gift.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected takeout from the account left her worried about finances.
meanings.sent5: The daily takeout from the account for coffee added up quickly.
